p.s: The novel Gun Love written by Jennifer Clement and published in 2019 deals with the first-person narrator Pearl and her mother Margot who live in a 1994 Mercury at a trailer in the middle in a bad part of Florida.
There they live in bad conditions and are rather socially isolated.

In the following text, I will comment the statement CPS should have taken Pearl away from Margot and the trailer park, put her into a foster home and help her to get a good education and prepare for a better and independent way of life.
First of all, the area where Pearl and Margot live is very dirty, unhealthy because of the dump, and lost place because there are not many people.
It is also far away from any cities.
That is why they are rather socially isolated but they got used to it and it was the way for Margot in order to protect herself and Pearl from her abusive father.
The conditions in which they live with not electricity, no gas burner, no furnitures etc. shows that they have not much opportunities especially Pearl has not much opportunities for a good education.

It should be a big help to help them financially because they really needed and her dream of a desk and a chair also underlines that her education is important for her but you do not have to forget that Pearl nevertheless goes to school.
This is possible for her because of the American Dream.
The American Dream offers all the people independetindependent on your money, on where you live, your religion etc. a better life.
Everyone has the opportunity to go to school and has a right for education.
Without the American Dream Pearl would not go to school because she is homeless and has not enough money.
For that reason there is no reason to take her away in order to help her to get a good education.

However, it could be a good decision to take her away in order to offer her a better life, to live in a house and meet new people because at the trailer park, she is not allowed to have many friends because of their of the CPSChild Protective Services but if they took her away, they would not have any fears.

With taking the results of my work on Helen, you can see that Pearl would be still feel her alone because she can notcannot know if she will change her foster homes as much as Helen did which leads to psychological problems.
Pearl also would feel herhere alone like Helen because of not getting love from anyone.
Margot's love to Pearl is very important for Pearl.
Without her family she can notcannot live a happy and perfect life.
Moreover, even though the American Dream promisspromises you to have a better life, it could be failed.
Many people mistrust the American Dream because the dream of many people did not get true.
That is why Pearl's dream of having a good education could be also failed and then she would live her life without her mother.

To the point taking Pearl away in order to prepare a better and independent way of life you do not have to forget that Pearl is still independent because at the trailer park you even do not have a shower.
It is Pearl's task to find a shower.
Pearl is also independent because she is brave enough to steal cigarettes which also shows that she is able to organize her life herself.
Especially with painting their car like a home and finding other thing in the car as furniture shows that they are really independetindependent.
There are maybe more independent that people at cities because there everything is still ordered.

All in all, I do not agree with the statement because Helen's life and situation showsshow that Pearl would have a terrible, sad and lonely life without her mother and she still goes to school because of the American Dream.
She does not need the help of the CPSChild Protective Service.
That is why I think she had to stay with her mother but maybe they could help them financially.
